config.question: What was distinctive about the Christianity of black slaves?

choices.content: The blacks transformed Christianity by retaining some of their African elements.
Black slaves adopted the theology but not the rituals of Christianity.
Blacks in the colonies adopted a Christianity that was Catholic in its theology but Puritan in its worship.
Most black people practiced Christianity publicly but Islam in private.

answer_3.response: The slaves accepted Christianity but did so on their own terms. Blacks transformed Christianity into an expression of religious feeling in which an African element remained vibrant.
